sentence.Network_en: Knowing that the end was so near, she became rather solicitous.
sentence.Network_cn: 她知道这一切即将结束, 反倒变得很有些放心不下了.

sentence.Network_en: He was so solicitous of his guests.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对他的客人们非常关切。

sentence.Network_en: Does it hurt, sir? His voice was flatly solicitous.
sentence.Network_cn: 打痛了吗, 首长? 他的口气似乎很关心,却毫无热情可言.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin sollicitus (see solicit) + -ous

entry.def: A person who is solicitous shows anxious concern for someone or something.

example.ex: He was so solicitous of his guests.
example.tran: 他对他的客人们非常关切。

auth_sentence.content: The service has been both quick and solicitous.
auth_sentence.res_content: The service has been both quick and solicitous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The service has been both quick and solicitous.

auth_sentence.content: Mitchell has been skillfully solicitous of the Republicans.

auth_sentence.content: Horace remembered how solicitous he had been when Loneese had been pregnant.
